Posted By: Ragamander (10/2/2010 11:41:23 PM)

posts.post_content: @Zacch: they're different. Nuisance Engine is a non-creature artifact, which makes it harder to kill off. Nuisance does not require green mana to cast. And Nuisance produces artifacts as opposed to elves, which can be useful. For instance, Nuisance Engine can feed a [Yawgmoth Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth Demon), Imperious Perfect can't.
posts.html:

Posted By: Arachnos (2/23/2011 9:51:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The cost is not worth it? True if you compare it to [Sacred Mesa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Mesa) or [Snake Basket](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snake Basket). But this engine is one of the cheapest for REUSABLE artifact token generation.   
  
Better than [Breeding pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breeding pit) in many cases too.  
  
I use this with [Bubble Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bubble Matrix) and [Worship](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worship). If all your creatures die, make a token so the worship protects you.  
  
I used to use [diamond kaleidoscope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=diamond kaleidoscope) but this is cheaper, even though you cannot sac them for mana.
posts.html:

Posted By: Zacch (1/27/2011 6:17:07 AM)
Rating:

@Concerned_Bystander
"artifact" is not capitalized in the token definition, thus it is a type, not a subtype. "Pest" is capitalized, indicating that it is a subtype.
So, written out in conventional format, the type line of the token would be "Artifact Creature - Pest"
